definition[0]: to build something such as a building or wall
example[0]: an imposing town hall, erected in 1892
example[1]: Police have erected barriers across the main roads into the town.
definition[1]: to fix all the pieces of something together, and put it in an upright position
example[2]: It took a couple of hours to erect the tent.
definition[2]: to establish something such as a system or institution
example[3]: Martin stood erect on the platform.
definition[4]: an erect penis or nipple is stiff and bigger than it usually is because a person is sexually excited
